name: grunt-bower
description: Copy bower installed components to dist folder.

0.1.0.name: grunt-bower
0.1.0.description: Copy bower installed components to dist folder.
0.1.0.readme:
# grunt-bower

Copy bower installed components to dist folder.

## Getting Started
Install this grunt plugin next to your project's [grunt.js gruntfile][getting_started] with: `npm install grunt-bower`

Then add this line to your project's `grunt.js` gruntfile:

```javascript
grunt.loadNpmTasks('grunt-bower');
```

[grunt]: http://gruntjs.com/
[getting_started]: https://github.com/gruntjs/grunt/blob/master/docs/getting_started.md

## Documentation
To your [grunt.js gruntfile][getting_started], add:

```javascript
bower: {
  dev: {
    dest: 'dest/path'
  }
}
```

## Contributing
In lieu of a formal styleguide, take care to maintain the existing coding style. Add unit tests for any new or changed functionality. Lint and test your code using [grunt][grunt].

## Release History
_(Nothing yet)_

## License
Copyright (c) 2012 curist  
Licensed under the MIT license.

0.2.0.name: grunt-bower
0.2.0.description: Copy bower installed components to dist folder.
0.2.0.readme:
# grunt-bower

Copy bower installed components to dist folder.

## Getting Started
Install this grunt plugin next to your project's [grunt.js gruntfile][getting_started] with: `npm install grunt-bower`

Then add this line to your project's `grunt.js` gruntfile:

```javascript
grunt.loadNpmTasks('grunt-bower');
```

[grunt]: http://gruntjs.com/
[getting_started]: https://github.com/gruntjs/grunt/blob/master/docs/getting_started.md

## Documentation
To your [grunt.js gruntfile][getting_started], add:

```javascript
bower: {
  dev: {
    dest: 'dest/path'
  }
}
```

add **basePath** option if you want to preserve library path:

```javascript
bower: {
  dev: {
    dest: 'dest/path',
    options: {
      basePath: 'components/'
    }
  }
}
```

## Contributing
In lieu of a formal styleguide, take care to maintain the existing coding style. Add unit tests for any new or changed functionality. Lint and test your code using [grunt][grunt].

## Release History
_(Nothing yet)_

## License
Copyright (c) 2012 curist  
Licensed under the MIT license.

0.3.0.name: grunt-bower
0.3.0.description: Copy bower installed components to dist folder.
0.3.0.readme:
# grunt-bower

Copy bower installed components to dist folder.

## First Thing First
This plugin doesn't set Bower as dependency to reduce the redundancy, but you should have Bower installed globally.
```sh
npm install -g bower
```

## Getting Started
Install this grunt plugin next to your project's [grunt.js gruntfile][getting_started] with: `npm install grunt-bower`

Then add this line to your project's `grunt.js` gruntfile:

```javascript
grunt.loadNpmTasks('grunt-bower');
```

[grunt]: http://gruntjs.com/
[getting_started]: https://github.com/gruntjs/grunt/blob/master/docs/getting_started.md

## Documentation
To your [grunt.js gruntfile][getting_started], add:

```javascript
bower: {
  dev: {
    dest: 'dest/path'
  }
}
```

add **basePath** option if you want to preserve library path:

```javascript
bower: {
  dev: {
    dest: 'dest/path',
    options: {
      basePath: 'components/'
    }
  }
}
```

## Contributing
In lieu of a formal styleguide, take care to maintain the existing coding style. Add unit tests for any new or changed functionality. Lint and test your code using [grunt][grunt].


## License
Copyright (c) 2012 curist
Licensed under the MIT license.

0.4.1.name: grunt-bower
0.4.1.description: Copy bower installed components to dist folder.
0.4.1.readme:
# grunt-bower

Copy bower installed components to dist folder.

## First Thing First
This plugin doesn't set Bower as dependency to reduce the redundancy, but you should have Bower installed globally.
```sh
npm install -g bower
```

## Getting Started
Install this grunt plugin next to your project's [grunt.js gruntfile][getting_started] with: `npm install grunt-bower`

Then add this line to your project's `grunt.js` gruntfile:

```javascript
grunt.loadNpmTasks('grunt-bower');
```

[grunt]: http://gruntjs.com/
[getting_started]: https://github.com/gruntjs/grunt/blob/master/docs/getting_started.md

## Documentation
To your [grunt.js gruntfile][getting_started], add:

```javascript
bower: {
  dev: {
    dest: 'dest/path'
  }
}
```

add **basePath** option if you want to preserve library path:

```javascript
bower: {
  dev: {
    dest: 'dest/path',
    options: {
      basePath: 'components/'
    }
  }
}
```

## Notes
grunt-bower currently need Bower version > 0.4 to work correctly, after `npm install -g bower` upgraded Bower, you might also want to `bower update` in your project directory to regenereate Bower created component.json.

## Change Logs
- Dec 14, 2012 v0.4.1

  try to guess the library file name if not provided by the installed component

## Contributing
In lieu of a formal styleguide, take care to maintain the existing coding style. Add unit tests for any new or changed functionality. Lint and test your code using [grunt][grunt].


## License
Copyright (c) 2012 curist
Licensed under the MIT license.

## First Thing First
This plugin doesn't set Bower as dependency to reduce the redundancy, but you should have Bower installed globally.
```sh
npm install -g bower
```

## Getting Started
Install this grunt plugin next to your project's [grunt.js gruntfile][getting_started] with: `npm install grunt-bower`

Then add this line to your project's `grunt.js` gruntfile:

```javascript
grunt.loadNpmTasks('grunt-bower');
```

- Dec 15, 2012 v0.4.2

# grunt-bower

Copy bower installed components to dist folder.

## First Thing First
This plugin doesn't set Bower as dependency to reduce the redundancy, but you should have Bower installed globally.
```sh
npm install -g bower
```

## Getting Started
Install this grunt plugin next to your project's [grunt.js gruntfile][getting_started] with: `npm install grunt-bower`

Then add this line to your project's `grunt.js` gruntfile:

```javascript
grunt.loadNpmTasks('grunt-bower');
```

[grunt]: http://gruntjs.com/
[getting_started]: https://github.com/gruntjs/grunt/blob/master/docs/getting_started.md

## Documentation
To your [grunt.js gruntfile][getting_started], add:

```javascript
bower: {
  dev: {
    dest: 'dest/path'
  }
}
```

add **basePath** option if you want to preserve library path:

```javascript
bower: {
  dev: {
    dest: 'dest/path',
    options: {
      basePath: 'components/'
    }
  }
}
```

## Change Logs
- Jan 31, 2013 v0.4.3

  Don't throw user out with error, and provides a little more informative warning messages.

- Jan 11, 2013 v0.4.2a

  Grunt v0.4.0+ support

- Dec 15, 2012 v0.4.2

  better handling the way to get file path to be copied, Bower v0.4.0 and above are supported

- Dec 14, 2012 v0.4.1

  try to guess the library file name if not provided by the installed component

This plugin doesn't set Bower as dependency to reduce the redundancy, but you should have Bower installed globally.

0.5.0.name: grunt-bower
0.5.0.description: Copy bower installed components to dist folder.
0.5.0.readme:
# grunt-bower

Copy bower installed components to dist folder.

## First Thing First
This plugin doesn't set Bower as dependency to reduce the redundancy, but you should have Bower installed globally.
```sh
npm install -g bower
```

## Getting Started
Install this grunt plugin next to your project's [grunt.js gruntfile][getting_started] with: `npm install grunt-bower`

Then add this line to your project's `grunt.js` gruntfile:

```javascript
grunt.loadNpmTasks('grunt-bower');
```

[grunt]: http://gruntjs.com/
[getting_started]: https://github.com/gruntjs/grunt/blob/master/docs/getting_started.md

## Documentation
To your [grunt.js gruntfile][getting_started], add:

```javascript
bower: {
  dev: {
    dest: 'dest/path'
  }
}
```

add **basePath** option if you want to preserve library path:

```javascript
bower: {
  dev: {
    dest: 'dest/path',
    options: {
      basePath: 'components/'
    }
  }
}
```

add **stripJsAffix** option if you'd like to have lib names with 'js' affix to be stripped:

```javascript
bower: {
  dev: {
    dest: 'dest/path',
    options: {
      stripJsAffix: true
    }
  }
}
```
**stripJsAffix** could cause name confliction, use with caution!

## Change Logs
- Feb 05, 2013 v0.5.0

  add option `stripJsAffix` to strip `/\W?js$/` in outputed file name.

- Feb 05, 2013 v0.4.4

  Grunt v0.4.0+ support, for real.

- Jan 31, 2013 v0.4.3

  Don't throw user out with error, and provides a little more informative warning messages.

- Jan 11, 2013 v0.4.2a

  Grunt v0.4.0+ support

- Dec 15, 2012 v0.4.2

  better handling the way to get file path to be copied, Bower v0.4.0 and above are supported

- Dec 14, 2012 v0.4.1

  try to guess the library file name if not provided by the installed component

## Contributing
In lieu of a formal styleguide, take care to maintain the existing coding style. Add unit tests for any new or changed functionality. Lint and test your code using [grunt][grunt].


## License
Copyright (c) 2012 curist
Licensed under the MIT license.

```javascript
grunt.loadNpmTasks('grunt-bower');
```

[grunt]: http://gruntjs.com/
[getting_started]: https://github.com/gruntjs/grunt/wiki/Getting-started

## Documentation
To your [grunt.js gruntfile][getting_started], add:

```javascript
bower: {
  dev: {
    dest: 'dest/path'
  }
}
```

add **basePath** option if you want to preserve library path:

```javascript
bower: {
  dev: {
    dest: 'dest/path',
    options: {
      basePath: 'components/'
    }
  }
}
```

add **stripJsAffix** option if you'd like to have lib names with 'js' affix to be stripped:

```javascript
bower: {
  dev: {
    dest: 'dest/path',
    options: {
      stripJsAffix: true
    }
  }
}
```
**stripJsAffix** could cause name confliction, use with caution!

## Change Logs
- Jul 28, 2013 v0.6.0

  support bower v1.0.0

- Feb 05, 2013 v0.5.0

  add option `stripJsAffix` to strip `/\W?js$/` in outputed file name.

- Feb 05, 2013 v0.4.4

  Grunt v0.4.0+ support, for real.

- Jan 31, 2013 v0.4.3

  Don't throw user out with error, and provides a little more informative warning messages.

- Jan 11, 2013 v0.4.2a

  Grunt v0.4.0+ support

- Dec 15, 2012 v0.4.2

  better handling the way to get file path to be copied, Bower v0.4.0 and above are supported

- Dec 14, 2012 v0.4.1

  try to guess the library file name if not provided by the installed component

## Contributing
In lieu of a formal styleguide, take care to maintain the existing coding style. Add unit tests for any new or changed functionality. Lint and test your code using [grunt][grunt].


## License
Copyright (c) 2012 curist
Licensed under the MIT license.
